sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &nvidia; vGPU is a graphics virtualization solution that provides multiple virtual machines (VMs) simultaneous access to one physical Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) on the &vmhost;. This article refers to the Volta and Ampere GPU architecture.

sect2.title: &nvidia; GPU architectures
sect2.para: There are two types of GPU architectures:

listitem.para: Introduced on GPUs that are based on the &nvidia; Ampere GPU architecture. Therefore, only Ampere GPU cards can support MIG-backed vGPU.

All GPU cards support time-sliced vGPU. For time-sliced vGPU architecture, Ampere GPU cards are based on Single Root I/O Virtualization (SR-IOV) mechanism. Volta and the earlier architecture are based on meditated device mechanism. These two mechanisms are transparent to a VM. However, they need different configurations from the host side.
